title: George Town
content: George Town, the capital of Penang, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its rich historical tapestry. Its streets are a vibrant blend of colonial architecture, traditional shophouses, and cultural landmarks. As you wa
content_more: nder through the city, youâ€™ll encounter a variety of murals that reflect local stories and traditions, alongside bustling markets and street food stalls. This dynamic urban environment celebrates the coexistence of diverse cultures, making George Town a living testament to Penangâ€™s multicultural identity.
address: George Town, Penang

title: Cheong Fatt Tze - The Blue Mansion
content: Known as the "Blue Mansion," Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion is a remarkable example of 19th-century Chinese architecture. Once home to a wealthy merchant, this stunning structure showcases the fusion of Eastern and Western design ele
content_more: ments, with its beautiful courtyards, intricate woodwork, and colorful tiles. Guided tours provide insights into the mansionâ€™s history, revealing the life of its former residents and the cultural exchanges that shaped Penang. The mansion stands as a symbol of the islandâ€™s rich historical narrative.
address: 14, Lebuh Leith, George Town, 10200 George Town, Pulau Pinang
fee: Entrance Fee for tour: RM 25 per person

title: Dhammikarama Burmese Temple
content: The Burmese Temple, or Dhammikarama Burmese Temple, is a tranquil space dedicated to Buddhist practices. This temple features a stunning pagoda and intricate sculptures that depict various aspects of Buddhist culture. The sere
content_more: ne atmosphere invites reflection and meditation, making it a beloved spot for both locals and visitors. The temple showcases the diverse religious landscape of Penang and highlights the contributions of the Burmese community to the islandâ€™s cultural heritage.
address: 24, Jalan Burma, Pulau Tikus, 10250 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Sri Aruloli Thirumurugan Temple
content: Sri Aruloli Thirumurugan, or better known as the Penang Hill Hindu Temple, is one of the oldest Hindu temples in Penang. It was set up in the 1800's as a small shrine to the Hindu deity Murugan (the deity associated with Thaip
content_more:
usam) by the Indian sepoys and sedan chair carriers, and is located at a mount within Penang Hill called Gun Hill.
 
 The Dravidian style of constructing Hindu temples calls for four principal parts. The temple proper, or vimana, is the shrine with a tower, a mandapa, or porch, gopurams, or gate towers, and chawadis, or pillar halls. In addition, there would usually be a tank of water for use in sacred rituals or for cleansing.
address: 11300, Penang Hill, Bukit Bendera, Penang

title: Suffolk House
content: Penang Mansion Restaurant Suffolk House is a stunning example of an Anglo-Indian garden house and Malaysia's only surviving Georgian Mansion, originally built in the early 1800s. For decades Suffolk House had a glittering care
content_more: er as the home of successive British Governors. The winner of the 2008 Award of Distinction in the UNESCO Asia-Pacific Heritage Awards for Culture Heritage Conservation this extensively and passionately restored mansion is now a "must visit" destination for everyone who comes to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of George Town, Penang.
address: C864+845, 250, Jalan Air Itam, 10460 George Town, Pulau Pinang
fee:
Admission costs for Adult: RM20
Children (under 6 yrs old) & Children on school: Free

title: Masjid Bukit Bendera (Penang Hill Mosque)
content: Masjid Bukit Bendera, also known as Penang Hill Mosque, is a serene gem nestled atop Penang Hill, Malaysia. Perched at 830 meters above sea level, this stunning mosque offers not just a spiritual haven, but also breathtaking p
content_more: anoramic views of the island. Built in a contemporary Islamic architectural style, it blends harmoniously with its lush surroundings. The mosque serves as a tranquil retreat for visitors and worshippers alike, making it a unique spot to experience both faith and nature amidst the vibrant landscapes of Penang.
address: Masjid, Bukit Bendera, 10000 Bukit Bendera, Pulau Pinang

title: Penang Street Art
content: Penang Street Art is a vibrant canvas of creativity that transforms the streets of Georgetown into an Open-air gallery. This dynamic art scene features stunning murals and playful installations that reflect the island's rich c
content_more: ulture and history. Artists, both local and international, have infused the city's walls with colorful narratives, capturing everything from everyday life to whimsical characters. As you stroll through the winding alleys, youâ€™ll discover captivating pieces that invite interaction and inspire exploration, making each turn a delightful surprise in this artistic urban landscape.
address: 316, Beach St, Georgetown, 10300 George Town, Penang

title: Snake Temple
content: The Snake Temple, also known as the Temple of the Azure Cloud, is a captivating blend of spirituality and nature located in Penang. Established in the early 19th century, this unique temple is dedicated to Kuan Yin, the goddes
content_more: s of mercy, and is famous for its resident snakes, which are believed to be sacred. As you wander through the temple's tranquil grounds, you’ll encounter live pit vipers lounging among the incense-filled altars, creating a mesmerizing atmosphere of reverence and wonder. The architectural beauty of the temple, combined with its intriguing legends and the harmonious coexistence of humans and snakes, makes it a must-visit destination for those seeking a truly unique cultural experience in Penang.
address: 10, Jalan Sultan Azlan Shah, Bandar Bayan Baru, 11900 Bayan Lepas, Pulau Pinang

title: Chaiya Mangalaram Thai Buddhist Temple
content: Chaiya Mangalaram Thai Buddhist Temple is a stunning architectural gem that offers a serene escape into Thai Buddhism right in the heart of Penang. Established in the late 19th century, this temple features intricate designs a
content_more: nd vibrant murals that showcase the rich cultural heritage of Thailand. One of its most striking highlights is the impressive reclining Buddha statue, which stretches an awe-inspiring 33 meters long, captivating visitors with its peaceful expression. The temple's tranquil gardens and peaceful ambiance provide a perfect backdrop for reflection and exploration, making Chaiya Mangalaram a must-visit for those looking to immerse themselves in the spiritual and artistic beauty of the region.
address: 17, Lorong Burma, Pulau Tikus, 10250 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Nagore Square
content: Nagore Square is a vibrant cultural enclave that showcases Penang's Indian Muslim heritage. Named after the town of Nagore in Tamil Nadu, India, the area is filled with old shophouses that date back over a century. Once bustli
content_more: ng with merchants, today Nagore Square is a lively district blending history with modernity. Traditional Indian Muslim restaurants, quaint shops, and beautifully restored buildings offer a taste of Penang’s multicultural fabric. The square is a melting pot where ancient trade routes, religious practices, and culinary traditions come together, embodying the spirit of the Indian Muslim community that has shaped Penang’s identity.
address: Jalan Nagor, 10400 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Jubilee Clock Tower
content: The Jubilee Clock Tower stands as a time-honored tribute to Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee in 1897. Rising 60 feet tall, symbolizing the 60 years of her reign, this tower near Fort Cornwallis is a beautiful blend of Moorish
content_more: and British colonial architecture. Its four-sided clock has been ticking through history, witnessing Penang's transformation from a colonial outpost to a modern city. Though the tower leans slightly due to bombing during World War II, its charm and historical significance remain undiminished, making it an enduring symbol of Penang’s colonial legacy and resilience.
address: Georgetown, 10200 George Town, Penang

title: Penang Heritage Trust
content: The Penang Heritage Trust (PHT) was established in 1986 as a charitable NGO, dedicated to promoting Penang's cultural and built heritage. Its objectives are to promote the conservation of Penang's heritage, to facilitate cultu
content_more: ral educational programmes, to organize public awareness programmes, and to cooperate with other like-minded organizations in Malaysia and abroad.
address: 26, Church St, Georgetown, 10200 George Town, Penang

title: Penang Town Hall
content: The City Hall is the local government headquarters of George Town within the Malaysian state of Penang. Built by the British, it now serves as the seat of the Penang Island City Council and was previously the seat of the Georg
content_more:
e Town City Council.
Both the City Hall and the Town Hall are located at Esplanade Road, overlooking the historic parade ground (the Padang) within the Esplanade. The buildings are also situated within George Town's UNESCO World Heritage Site.
address: LOT 70, Jalan Padang Kota Lama, SEKSYEN 19, 10200 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Loo Pun Hong
content: Loo Pun Hong may not have the grand facades of Penang’s larger temples, but what it lacks in size, it more than makes up for in charm and historical significance. This small but venerable Taoist temple, hidden among the heri
content_more: tage shophouses of George Town, is dedicated to the God of Medicine. Locals have been visiting Loo Pun Hong for generations to seek blessings for health and well-being. With its humble architecture and the faint scent of incense wafting through the air, the temple offers a peaceful retreat from the city’s hustle. The temple’s history is intertwined with the local Chinese community’s dedication to preserving their spiritual traditions. Despite its modest size, Loo Pun Hong holds a deep spiritual resonance, embodying the quiet yet enduring devotion of its followers over the centuries.
address: Lorong Love, George Town, 10200 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Tow Boo Kong Temple Butterworth
content: Just across the strait in Butterworth, Tow Boo Kong Temple is a grand Taoist temple dedicated to the Nine Emperor Gods. Known for its opulent design, the temple is an architectural masterpiece, with intricately carved pillars,
content_more: towering dragon sculptures, and vibrant murals. During the Nine Emperor Gods Festival, the temple becomes a bustling center of activity, drawing devotees from across Malaysia for its elaborate rituals and processions. Its spiritual significance, combined with its visual grandeur, makes Tow Boo Kong a captivating cultural and religious landmark that showcases the rich tapestry of Taoism in Penang.
address: 894 & 896, MK14, Jalan Raja Uda, 12300 Butterworth, Pulau Pinang

title: Tropical Spice Garden
content: Tropical Spice Garden is a botanical garden located in Penang, Malaysia, that is dedicated to showcasing the diversity and importance of the region's spices and herbs. The garden covers an area of eight acres and is home to a
content_more:
wide variety of tropical plants, including over 500 species of herbs and spices from around the world.The garden is designed to be both beautiful and educational, with a range of attractions and activities for visitors of all ages. 

Tropical Spice Garden also offers a range of activities and workshops for visitors, including guided tours, cooking classes, and even a chance to make your own natural soap using herbs and spices from the garden.

Overall, Tropical Spice Garden is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in the natural beauty and rich cultural heritage of Penang and Malaysia. It's a unique and educational experience that offers something for everyone, whether you're a seasoned gardener, a foodie, or simply looking to relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.
address: Lot 595 Mukim, 2, Jalan Teluk Bahang, Teluk Bahang, 11050 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Penang Hill
content: Penang Hill is the oldest British hill station in Southeast Asia, dated late 1700’s. The highest peak of Penang Hill stand at 833 metres (2,732ft) above sea level. Penang Hill funicular train service started on October 1923
content_more: The current funicular trains is the 4th generation system which started its operation on 24th April 2011. The funicular track stretches a distance of 1,996 metres (1.99KM) from lower to Upper Station which is the longest in Asia. Penang Hill funicular tunnel, at 79 metres (258ft) long and 10feet (3.0m) wide with a steepness of 27.9degree, is the steepest tunnel track in the world. There are a total of 52 hill bungalows located on Penang Hill (42 of them are private-owned and 10 bungalows are state-owned). Most of them are more than 100 years old and Bel Retiro (Governors Bungalows) built in1789 is the oldest. Number of visitor to Penang Hill in 2016 exceed 1.6million.
address: Penang Hill, Bukit Bendera, 11300 Bukit Bendera, Penang

title: The Habitat Penang Hill
content: The Habitat Penang Hill provides the most authentic, diverse and educational Malaysian rainforest experience. Reconnect with nature in its purest form as you immerse yourself in our 130-million year old rainforest. Starting at
content_more: the forest floor, our Naturalists will take you on a journey along our Nature Trail to explore the myriad of flora and fauna – plants, trees, insects, birds, reptiles, and mammals that call The Habitat home. Explore the biodiversity of the rainforest canopy on our 230m Langur Way Canopy Walk. Visit Curtis Crest Tree Top Walk at the top of Penang Hill, and embrace the 360-degree panoramic views of Penang Island from the highest viewing point of Penang. Our Shop on the Hill carries educational and ethically produced merchandise themed around all things nature and culture. Finish at our Habitat Café with refreshments ranging from artisanal coffee,and gourmet cakes. Discover a different side of Penang Hill.
address: C7G9+69, Bukit Bendera, 11300 Bukit Bendera, Pulau Pinang

title: Entopia by Penang Butterfly Farm
content: Opened in 1986, the Penang Butterfly Farm – located in Teluk Bahang – is one of Penang’s best known and most popular tourist attractions. The eight-hectare butterfly sanctuary houses an impressively varied collection of
content_more: butterfly species as well as an assortment of other insects. The farm sits at the foot of the Teluk Bahang hills – between the Taman Rimba Park and Teluk Bahang village. It features more than 4,000 butterflies from more than 120 groups as well as other insects and reptiles.

title: Penang Botanic Gardens
content: The Penang Botanic Gardens, more popularly known as Waterfall Gardens, was established by the British way back in 1884 from an old granite quarry site. It lies in a deep valley, at the foot of 366 feet jungle-clad hills, bound
content_more: by evergreen tropical rain forests, divided by a cascading stream that meanders through a sprawling 29 hectares of prime and undulating grounds. Its lush greenery and tranquil setting make it a favorite park and a popular tourist attraction. It is Penang's unique natural heritage, being the only one of its kind in Malaysia. Besides, being a repository of flora & unique to the country and to the region, it serves as a "green lung" for Metropolitan Penang.
address: Kompleks Pentadbiran,Bangunan Pavilion, Jalan Kebun Bunga, 10350 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Batu Ferringhi Beach
content: Batu Feringghi is a resort strip with white sandy beaches. There are a number of large and luxurious Batu Feringghi hotels. They are Hard Rock Hotel, Golden Sands Resort, Bayview Beach Resort and more. Batu Feringghi is indeed
content_more:
an ideal place for a great relaxing vacation, nothing but a getaway from cities, exclusively for urbanites.

There are a lot of activities that can be done during the visit to Batu Feringghi. They are mostly water sports activities, such as canoeing and sailing. Apart from them, one can experience horse riding along the beach or just simply strolling and enjoying the cool breeze.

Feringghi Garden is the best place to dine in for all visitors. This restaurant has been the talk of the town for months. The environment is romantic with interesting outdoor sitting. The food offered is capable in tantalizing your taste buds and the prices are affordable. There is a nearby attraction that you should pay a visit to Pantai Teluk Bahang Penang. There, you can enjoy the tranquility of nature with breezing wind. Besides, there are museum and park that worth a visit.
address: Jalan Batu Ferringhi Batu Ferringhi, 11100 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Teluk Bahang Beach
content: Teluk Bahang is once a quiet, isolated fishing village. Its beach is idyllic with white fine sand and cool water. These features are what attract tourists from all different countries. The beach offers more green compared to o
content_more:
ther beaches in Penang. It possesses a serenity environment. Sitting by the beach, waiting for the sun to set is the best thing to do at Teluk Bahang Beach. However, it is not suitable to swim at the sea of this very beach due to the presence of jellyfishes.

Apart from the amazing beach, there are more attractions in Teluk Bahang. They are Tropical Spice Garden, Penang National Park,Batik Factory, Penang Forestry Museum and Penang Butterfly Farm. Penang Butterfly Farm features insects and plants, not to mention the various species of butterflies. You can stay in Batu Feringghi Hotel if you plan to visit Teluk Bahang Beach as a one day trip.
address: SBLH 3592 Persisiran Pantai Hujung Batu, Jalan Teluk Bahang, Teluk Bahang, 11050, Pulau Pinang

title: Kerachut Beach (Pantai Keracut)
content: Pantai Kerachut or Kerachut Beach is a lovely stretch of white sandy beach located in the Penang National Park on Penang Island and is home to the Penang Turtle Sanctuary, which is located just behind the beach. There is also
content_more: a very rare meromictic lake here (a lake of two layers of salt and fresh water that don't mix) but to be honest, you can't really see that much, just looks like any other lake and sometimes the lake is totally empty. With such a beautiful beach and especially if just walked through the rainforest and are hot and sweaty, you may be tempted to take a swim.
address: Teluk Bahang, Tanjung Bungah, Pulau Pinang

title: Monkey Beach
content: A 90-minute walk from Penang National Park’s main gate, Monkey Beach is a scenic beach featuring water sports, wild monkeys and the authentic beach-getaway experience complete with fresh coconut water. After an eventful day
content_more: at the beach, hop on a speed boat for a small fee to return in style.
address: Jalan Hassan Abas, Teluk Bahang, 11050 Tanjung Bungah, Pulau Pinang

title: Tanjung Bungah Beach
content: Tanjung Bungah is used to known as a quiet fishing village, until it is filled with tourists and locals who work in the hotel nearby. Tanjung Bungah Hotels are far more affordable than Batu Feringghi hotels and Georgetown hote
content_more: ls. Penang Water Sports Centre is based in Tanjung Bungah and so, water sports such as kayak and boat are very popular there. One of the tourist's attractions there is the Penang Toy Museum. It is renowned as the world's largest toy museum with more than 100,000 toy collections.
address: 11200 Tanjung Bungah, Pulau Pinang

title: Penang Municipal Park (Youth park)
content: Nestled in the heart of Penang Island, the Penang Municipal Park or Youth Park, also known as Taman Perbandaran Pulau Pinang, offers a serene escape into nature's embrace. It was Opened in 1972 and is located near Penang Botan
content_more:
ic Garden. This verdant sanctuary, rich in biodiversity and meticulously maintained landscapes, serves as an ideal destination for tourists seeking both tranquility and adventure. Its strategic location, easily accessible from George Town, makes it a convenient spot for visitors eager to explore Penang's natural beauty.

The park sprawls over 172 acres, providing ample space for a myriad of activities. Visitors can immerse themselves in the lush greenery by taking a leisurely stroll along well-marked trails. These paths meander through various sections of the park, revealing diverse flora and fauna that thrive in this tropical environment. The meticulously curated gardens, adorned with vibrant flowers and rare plants, offer a picturesque setting for photography enthusiasts.

One of the park's standout features is the cascading waterfall, which provides a refreshing respite from the tropical heat. The sound of water tumbling over rocks creates a soothing ambiance, perfect for those looking to unwind. Nearby, the lily pond, with its serene waters and blooming lilies, adds to the park's tranquil charm. For families, the well-equipped playgrounds and picnic areas offer spaces to relax and enjoy quality time together.

Fitness enthusiasts will find the Penang Municipal Park particularly appealing. The park boasts a range of facilities designed to promote physical well-being. Outdoor gym equipment is strategically placed throughout the park, encouraging visitors to engage in strength training and cardiovascular exercises amidst nature. The jogging and cycling tracks, shaded by towering trees, provide an invigorating environment for workouts. Additionally, the park regularly hosts tai chi and yoga sessions, blending physical fitness with mental relaxation.

Wildlife enthusiasts will be delighted by the diverse species inhabiting the park. Birdwatchers can spot various avian species, including kingfishers, sunbirds, and even the elusive hornbill. The park's ponds and streams are home to amphibians and fish, adding to the rich biodiversity. Educational signage throughout the park provides information about the local ecosystem, enhancing the visitor experience.

Sustainability and conservation are key priorities at the Penang Municipal Park. The park management employs eco-friendly practices, including waste segregation and recycling initiatives. Visitors are encouraged to participate in these efforts by disposing of waste responsibly and minimizing their environmental footprint. The park also serves as a venue for environmental awareness programs and workshops, fostering a deeper appreciation for nature among the community and tourists alike.

The Penang Municipal Park is more than just a recreational space; it is a testament to the harmonious coexistence of urban life and nature. Whether you are seeking a peaceful retreat, an active day out, or an educational experience, the park caters to diverse interests and preferences. Its commitment to conservation, coupled with its array of amenities, makes it a must-visit destination for tourists exploring Penang.
address: Persiaran Kuari, Pulau Tikus, 10450 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Teluk Bahang Forest Eco Park (Taman Rimba)
content: Also known as the Teluk Bahang Recreational Park, Taman Rimba is a vast, 32ha forest park that serves as a good introduction to the Malaysian rainforest. Teluk Bahang Forest Park is a beautiful nature reserve located on the no
content_more: rthwestern coast of Penang Island in Malaysia. The park is well-equipped with picnic and camping areas, a playground, a forestry museum and a substantial network of hiking trails. Explore the trails and take in the wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat. The icing on the cake is surely the waterfall where one can take a dip to cool off while enjoying the surrounding greenery.
address: Lorong Rimba, Teluk Bahang, 11050 Tanjung Bungah, Pulau Pinang

title: Sia Boey Urban Archaeological Park
content: The Sia Boey Urban Archaeological Park, also colloquially known as the Sia Boey, is an urban archaeology park within the city of George Town in the Malaysian state of Penang. Located at Prangin Road, it is touted as the first
content_more:
Urban Archaeological Park in the country.

The Sia Boey Urban Archaeological Park contains various recreational amenities, such as a koi fish-filled revitalised Prangin Canal, aged-old trees and a playground for the kids, all of which are Open to the public. The park is maintained by the Penang Development Corporation. The cost of diverting and restoring the old canal, as well as the construction of the new canal and "archaeological" works, was RM9.1 million ringgit, while the Old Prangin Market was being restored at a cost of RM5.1 million.
address: 72, Jalan Magazine, George Town, 10300 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Straits Quay Sunset Cruise
content: The Sunset Cruise in Penang offers a serene and unforgettable experience, perfect for those looking to witness the island’s natural beauty from a unique perspective. Departing from the Straits Quay Marina in Tanjung Tokong,
content_more:
just a short drive from George Town, this cruise provides an unparalleled view of Penang's stunning coastline as the sun sets over the horizon.

The cruise typically lasts around two to three hours, giving guests ample time to relax and take in the breathtaking scenery. As you glide across the calm waters of the Andaman Sea, the panoramic views of Penang Island's shoreline, with its mix of modern skyscrapers and historical landmarks, offer a picturesque backdrop. The highlight of the cruise is, of course, the sunset itself—a dazzling display of colors that paint the sky in hues of orange, pink, and purple, creating a perfect moment to capture on camera.

The Sunset Cruise is not just about the views; it's also a chance to indulge in a comfortable and luxurious experience. The boats used for the cruise are well-equipped with amenities such as spacious decks, comfortable seating, and often a selection of refreshments or light snacks. Some cruises even offer dinner options, allowing you to enjoy a meal as you watch the sun dip below the horizon. Whether you’re traveling solo, as a couple, or with a group, the cruise provides a tranquil and romantic setting that is sure to leave a lasting impression.
address: Seri Tanjung Pinang, Tanjung Tokong, Pulau Pinang

title: Air Itam Dam
content: Commissioned in 1962, the Air Itam Dam has a maximum effective capacity of 2.16 billion litres of water. The Air Itam Dam still serves as an important component of Penang’s water supply infrastructure. The top water level is
content_more:
235 metres above sea level and its storage capacity is tapped to sustain continuous good water supply in the Air Itam township and nearby highland areas.

The refreshing environment has a loyal following amongst walkers, runners and cyclists, some of whom enjoy the challenge of “climbing up” a 200 metre ascent. Upon reaching the dam premise, there is also a 2.6km “circuit”, winding around the perimeter of the dam, including its 243.8 metre crest.
address: Jln Balik Pulau, George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Teluk Bahang Dam
content:
The Teluk Bahang Dam forms the largest permanent body of fresh water on Penang Island.With a maximum surface area of 0.95 sq. km, it overlooks the beaches of Teluk Bahang, at the north western tip of the island.

Designed an
content_more: d built to serve as Penang’s strategic drought reserve, it was officially Opened in 1999. The effective storage capacity of the Teluk Bahang Dam is 18.24 billion litres of water, or roughly 8.9 times more water than the Air Itam Dam. This dam proved its worth during the extended dry seasons in 2014 and 2015 when PBAPP tapped its waters to avoid water rationing on Penang Island.
address: 772, Jalan Tanjung Bungah, Teluk Bahang, 11050 Tanjung Bungah, Pulau Pinang

title: Tropical Fruit Farm
content: Welcome to Penang Tropical Fruit Farm. We have South East Asia’s largest collection of fruits with an active area that spans a sprawling 25 acres located in the North West of Penang, Malaysia. With over 200 species of edible
content_more:
fruits identified, we aim to promote the amazing flora of Malaysia through education and information. Tropical Fruit Farm is situated about 800ft above sea level on the hilly terrains of Teluk Bahang in Penang. It is an ideal location for cultivating many types of tropical and sub-tropical fruit trees. The orchard was developed back in 1993 with a few objectives in mind.

Firstly, to conserve rare and exotic fruit trees. Secondly, to educate and promote to the locals as well as foreigners of the gift that our land is blessed with. Lastly, to play a positive role towards agriculture and eco/agro tourism amid the intensive development in our state’s rural areas.

Over the years, the orchard has acquired many rare and exotic fruit trees from the region as well as from far-flung corners of the globe such as Central and South America, Central Africa, India, the Middle East, the Caribbean, the Pacific Islands etc. Today the orchard boasts of a collection of over 200 different species and the list is still growing.

The farm endeavours to use only organic fertilisers. Some of which are processed in the farm using fruit waste collected from around the farm. Chemicals are only used when absolutely necessary. In the farm, our aim is to work towards a cleaner environment for the future. Apart from viewing the fruits, you will be able to enjoy the varieties of fruits (minimum 15 types!) when you join one of our Guided Farm Tours. The orchard also prepares light snacks, juices and a specially prepared buffet spread for pre-booked groups.
address: 18th Mile, Stone, Jalan Teluk Bahang, Teluk Bahang, 11050 George Town, Penang

title: Forest Recreation Park
content: Beautiful floras and faunas can be found in this 100-acre landscaped park. Penang Forestry Museum or Muzium Perhutanan Pulau Pinang, is a museum that was set up to generate greater appreciation among the general public for the
content_more: rainforest in Penang. Constructed in 1976 and first Opened to the public in 1983, the museum covers a 700 sq meter site. It was constructed using various types of wood. The main exhibition hall is supported by the trunk of a single forest tree. Penang Forestry Museum has exhibits showcasing the different types of wood and wood products. There are eight dioramas showing the different types of forest including the mangrove swamp forest, swamp forest, coastal hill forest, lowland dipterocarp forest, hill dipterocarp forest, upper hill dipterocarp forest, montane oak forest and montane ericaceous forest. The museum is really geared towards educating children and school students. Due to its proximity with the Batu Ferringhi tourist belt, it receives a small stream of tourists.
address: Jalan Taman Rimba, Teluk Bahang, 11050, Pulau Pinang

title: Taman Awam Metropolitan Relau
content: Taman Awam Metropolitan Relau is a public recreational area that provides an entertaining space for leisure and outdoor activities. It is designed to cater to individuals and families looking for a place to relax and enjoy the
content_more:
mselves. Well-maintained pavilions allow you to sit, unwind, and take in the surroundings. These shaded areas offer a pleasant spot to rest, picnic, or enjoy the fresh air.

For the little ones, there is a children's playground equipped with fun and safe play structures. Kids can engage in active play, make new friends, and have an enjoyable time under the watchful eyes of their parents or guardians. Toilet facilities are conveniently available, allowing visitors to freshen up or attend to personal needs. Additionally, there is a surau, providing a designated space for prayer.

The park serves as a beautiful recreational area for families. Families can engage in various activities, such as picnicking, playing games, or enjoying quality time in nature. Taman Awam Metropolitan Relau also offers opportunities for exercise and physical activity. Whether you prefer jogging, walking, or engaging in other fitness routines, the park's Open spaces and pathways provide ample room for exercise.
address: Lebuh Relau 4, 11900 Bayan Lepas, Pulau Pinang

title: Audi Dream Farm
content: Audi Dream Farm offers a unique and exciting experience for visitors who are looking for something different to do in Penang. One of the highlights of the farm is the animal feeding basket set, which allows visitors to get up
content_more:
Closed and personal with a variety of tame animals. This is a great opportunity for animal lovers to interact with animals such as rabbits, guinea pigs, and goats, and to learn more about them.

In addition to the animal feeding experience, visitors can also enjoy other activities such as planting and fishing. The farm grows non-toxic chemicals and nature growing plants, which visitors can learn about and even plant themselves. Fishing is another popular activity, and visitors can try their hand at catching fish in the farm's ponds.

Overall, Audi Dream Farm is a great place to enjoy nature and learn about traditional culture in Penang. It's a perfect activity for families and friends who are looking for a fun and educational experience that's different from the typical tourist attractions.
address: Audi dreamfarm 145, MK B, Sg.Rusa, 11010 Balik Pulau, Pulau Pinang

title: Bukit Hijau, Cangkat Tembaga Hiking Trail
content: The hike starts at the foot of Bukit Hijau, where hikers will follow a well-marked staircase with stone steps first up to a shrine set above a pond. Along the way, hikers can enjoy beautiful views of the Paya Terubong Valley a
content_more:
nd Kek Lok Si Temple on the flank of Penang Hill. As you reach the top of Bukit Hijau, the trail will lead you to a small platform with a great view of the surrounding area.

From Bukit Hijau, the trail will continue to Bukit Lanchang, which also offers nice views. Along the way, hikers will encounter exposed roots, which can make the trail slippery, but there are ropes to assist with the climb. Hikers can also spot various flora and fauna such as wild orchids and monkeys along the trail. At the peak of Bukit Lanchang, hikers can enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding area.
address: Cangkat Tembaga, Taman Greenview, Jelutong, Pulau Pinang

title: Air Hitam Dalam Educational Forest
content: The Air Hitam Dalam Educational Forest is located in the North Seberang Perai District of Penang. It is a fresh water swamp and is home to various wildlife and plant species. Its name ‘Air Hitam Dalam’ refers to a river ne
content_more:
arby that is deep and dark. Housing an ecosystem that has many plants and animals, especially birds. 

The facilities of Air Hitam Dalam include a 1000m canopy walkway, rest hut, hanging bridges and observation towers. There are two observation towers here that are linked by a 210m suspension bridge. Birding is possible where the sites for birding are canopied and connected by a 1,163m boardwalk. The park has an area of about eleven hectares and is managed by the State Forestry Department . This place has been praised for its environmental preservation and cleanliness.

This park is Open to the public and is a hot destination for nature photographers (especially bird photographers), enabling them to capture the natural beauty of the animals found within the area. They consist of monitor lizards, otters, owls, eagles, long-tailed macaques, mangrove pittas, plantain squirrels, woodpeckers, kingfishers and many more!
address: 13310 Air Hitam, Pulau Pinang

title: Firefly Sanctuary
content: Hop on board and don’t forget to fasten your life jacket as you cruise along Kerian River for magnificent views of fireflies dancing against the night sky. A truly magical experience, this boat ride is sure to leave your ent
content_more: ire family in awe of the beauty found in nature. View the twinkling fireflies on a sunset cruise along the Sungai Kerian riverbank. It’s not all about the fireflies, however; visitors here can also engage in some octopus catching, bat cave exploration and fit in a visit to Penang’s largest sea fish cage farm.
address: 2934, Jalan Teluk Ipil, 14300 Nibong Tebal, Pulau Pinang

title: Bukit Mertajam Forest Park
content: Bukit Mertajam Recreational Forest, also known as Bukit Mertajam Hill, is a popular destination among outdoor enthusiasts in Penang. It covers an area of approximately 37 hectares and is home to a variety of flora and fauna. T
content_more:
here are several trails within the forest that cater to hikers of different skill levels, offering scenic views and a chance to immerse in nature.

It is a great place for outdoor enthusiasts to enjoy a range of activities, such as hiking, jogging, and picnicking. The forest is home to several notable landmarks, such as the Seraya Hill, Storny House, Bukit Mertajam viewpoint, Three Red Chair viewpoint, the Dragon Gate, and a picturesque lake. These landmarks offer stunning panoramic views of the area and provide great opportunities for photography.
address: 15 Jalan Kolam, Bukit Mertajam 14000 Malaysia

title: Penang Bird Park
content: The first & largest bird park of its kind in Malaysia, established since 1988, the 5-acre park on the mainland portion of Penang State, has a collection of more than 300 species of birds from all over the world, of which more
content_more:
than 150 species are of Malaysian Species. More than 3,000 birds in this park are carefully and scientifically housed in more than 150 cages for the breeding and conservation purpose.

While the 2 Geodesic Domes and 2 giant sized Walk-in-Aviaries, keep hundreds of tamed birds which offers priceless memory and exciting moment for visitors, after hand-feeding them, exotic birds ranging from tiny Sunbirds to huge, gigantic 8-foot tall Ostriches frolic in an environment that imitates their natural habitat. Penang Bird Park is particularly proud of its hornbills, sunbirds, and pheasants collection. Penang Bird Park is the bird-park loved by the expert ornithologists as well as for the people of all ages who love birds.

Built in a garden concept, the park boasts of its beautiful landscaping with the impressive collections of hibiscus, orchids,  bamboo, ornamental plant and palm trees. Cascading waterfalls and natural ponds flourish with colourful fishes, lotus and water lilies, creating a home for the free-roaming pelicans, flamingos, swans, egrets, storks, herons and colourful ducks. Observe from the Chinese-style wooden bridges that traverse the water or relax in the little Malay huts that dot the park to enjoy the beauty of nature at play. A cosy air-conditioned restaurant in the park serves delicious local and western food.

Penang Bird Park is also a home to several species of deers including the smallest deer in the world - Mouse-Deers. Giant Arapaima fish, pythons, giant estuarine crocodile, tortoises and other species of wildlife are also exhibited in this park.
address: Jalan Todak Seberang Jaya, 13700 Perai, Penang

title: Peacock Echo Park Perai
content: Set to Open its doors this December 2021, Penang’s first peacock aviary sanctuary in Kimsar Garden, Prai, will showcase 50 peacocks from nine different species. The aviary/mini zoo aims to be an educational tourism attractio
content_more: n where visitors can discover many varieties of this beautiful large pheasant, known for its brightly-coloured feathers. The aviary features the albino version of Indian peacocks, Javanese mix peacocks from Belgium, Pied and Black Shoulder peacocks from Spain, among others. The public can have a picnic by the river or the lotus pond at the park while enjoying the view and learn a thing or two about peacocks, free of charge.
address: 1038, Jalan Chain Ferry, Taman Kimsar, 13600 Perai, Pulau Pinang

title: Frog Hill
content: Frog Hill in Penang may be one of the most photographed places in the Mainland of the state, Seberang Perai. The speciality of this place is the many shimmering water pools set in a former quarry site. It’s a delight for pho
content_more:
tographers to come here and shoot at sunrise or sunset — but you can come here to enjoy the views pretty much at any time of the day. Frog Hill is a former mining site filled with water that became famous on Instagram when locals started calling it “the Jiuzhaigou of Penang”.

A hike to Frog Hill, however, is perfect for beginners, friends and couples looking for a scenic and quiet place to go on a date or a picnic. To be precise, Frog Hill is more of a sightseeing spot than one “hiking spot” such as Penang Hill and Bukit Hijau on the island, or the many hiking trails in Penang Mainland, such as nearby Bukit Juru, Cherok Tok Kun, Berapit and Bukit Panchor, for example. And if you are looking for a diminutive island, don’t miss Pulau Aman and nearby Batu Kawan.
address: Unnamed Road 14400, Kubang Semang, Penang

title: Kampung Agong
content: Starting in 1942, the founder of the land started to plant the coconut tree and paddy fields as soon innovated to “Agro Themed Park”. Kampung Agong was named by the nickname of the land founder which villagers called the f
content_more:
ounder as ‘Agong’.

Walk around you can find more than 15 different sizes and shapes of bird nests which are inspired by actual weaver birds around here. Besides that, there is also a giant swing beside the paddy field accompanied by sunset in the evening. A decoy white grand wooden piano surrounded by paddy fields and hundreds of coconut trees also one of the hot instagrammable spots.

Kampung Agong also has the wisdom of traditional architecture which includes jelapang padi, rumah kampung, and so on. Furthermore, you can also stretch your legs and explore other areas in Kampung Agong such as the pond that is sprawled with water lilies. After walking around and immersing in the relaxing landscape, you can hop on the bicycle to check out different corners here.
address: 841, Kampung Bakar Kapor, 13100 Penaga, Pulau Pinang

title: Pulau Aman
content: Pulau Aman (translated as “Island of Peace”) is not just one of Penang best beaches, but also one of Seberang Perai main attractions. It is so small and laid-back that even most locals let it slip under their radars. Home
content_more:
to a community of 300 fishermen, its quaint, car-free alleys offer timeless tropical bliss. To catch up with modernity, one must hop on the short bumboat ride (RM8 roundtrip) back to the Batu Musang jetty and the mainland.

Comprising of two islets – Pulau Aman and inhabited atoll Pulau Gedung – Pulau Aman was occupied by the Bugis ethnic group of Kedah in 1817 and has been a rural fishing community ever since. The island is relatively small covering 1.2 square kilometres and has a 4-kilometres walking path that snakes all around it.
address: Bagan Luar, 12200 Butterworth, Pulau Pinang

title: Sri Weld Food Court
content: Sri Weld Food Court, located in the bustling commercial heart of George Town on Beach Street (Lebuh Pantai), is a popular destination for locals seeking an affordable and satisfying breakfast or lunch. Famous for its nasi lema
content_more: k, served in traditional banana leaf parcels, the food court offers a variety of options including boiled egg, chicken, fried fish, and squid nasi lemak, making it a top choice for many. In addition to nasi lemak, visitors can indulge in other local delights such as laksa, flavorful clay pot chicken rice, and nasi kandar, making Sri Weld a must-visit for anyone exploring Penang's vibrant street food scene.
address: Beach St, Georgetown, 10300 George Town, Penang

title: Hon Kei Food Corner
content: Hon Kei Food Corner, located in Kampong Malabar, George Town, was previously a stall in Ho Ping Coffee Shop at the junction of Penang Road and Jalan Kampong Malabar. This eatery is famous for its delicious pork noodles, fish h
content_more: ead noodles, and porridge, making it a favorite among locals and visitors. Its cozy and casual atmosphere offers a welcoming space to enjoy hearty and flavorful meals.
address: 43, Kampong Malabar, George Town, 10200 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Lee Huat Cafe
content: Lee Huat Cafe continues to serve a wide range of hawker food items that Penangites love for breakfast. The menu features delicious options like curry noodles, jawa noodles, nasi lemak, popiah rolls, and hokkien prawn noodles,
content_more: all bursting with flavor and aroma. It’s a great spot to enjoy satisfying meals with your loved ones and experience the best of Penang's culinary delights.
address: 377-B, Jln Masjid Negeri, Taman Green Lane, 11600 Jelutong, Penang

title: No.76 Coffee Stall
content: No.76 Coffee Stall is the ideal spot for a quick and tasty breakfast in Penang, famous for its crispy toast topped with butter and kaya (coconut jam), paired with perfectly soft-boiled eggs, this stall offers a range of local
content_more: delights. From fragrant nasi lemak to delectable nyonya pastries, there's something to satisfy every craving. The highlight, however, is the adorable latte art on their classic kopi drinks, whether you prefer them hot or ice-cold. Enjoy your coffee with a touch of foamy cuteness that makes your breakfast experience extra special!
address: 19, Medan Batu Lanchang, Jelutong, 11600 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Big Crab Street Food
content: Big Crab Street Food is a sprawling food court that offers a wide variety of Penang’s culinary delights with the convenience of ample parking. With numerous stalls, you can indulge in everything from Chinese and Indian mee t
content_more: o Western, Japanese, and steamed rice dishes. The seafood stall is particularly popular, serving delicious stingray, binjal, and crab that are highly recommended. The spacious venue allows you to choose between indoor or outdoor seating, both offering a comfortable dining atmosphere. For a relaxed meal, the street-side tables provide the perfect setting to enjoy your food.
address: 28, Jalan Perusahaan Jelutong 2, Fortune Park, 11600 Jelutong, Pulau Pinang

title: Lucky Eatery Food Court Centre
content: Lucky Eatery Food Court Centre offers a diverse selection of food, with Chinese, Malay, and Indian stalls catering to all tastes. It's an ideal spot for a relaxed meal at affordable prices. Most of the hawker stalls operate du
content_more: ring lunch, making it a popular lunchtime destination for locals and visitors alike. Whether you're craving flavorful rice dishes, noodles, or snacks, there's something for everyone at this vibrant food court.
address: 11900, Medan Bayan, 11900 Bayan Lepas, Pulau Pinang

title: Astaka Sungai Pinang
content: Astaka Sungai Pinang is a bustling food court that offers a wide variety of food options, including popular local dishes like bak kut teh and seafood. In addition to local fare, you'll find a selection of Thai and Chinese cuis
content_more: ine, providing a diverse range of flavors to suit every palate. With numerous food stalls to choose from, this lively spot is perfect for exploring different culinary delights in one place.
address: Lebuh Sungai Pinang Jelutong, 11600 George Town

title: Kompleks Makanan Medan Renong Padang Kota Lama
content: Kompleks Makanan Medan Renong Padang Kota Lama is a vibrant food court located near the sea, offering a mix of Chinese and Malay food stalls. Known for its delicious green tomyam and flavorful rojak, it’s a great spot to enj
content_more: oy local delicacies with a stunning waterfront view. Whether you're craving spicy soups or refreshing fruit salads, this food court provides an ideal setting to savor Penang's culinary delights while soaking in the sea breeze.
address: 4, Jalan Tun Syed Sheh Barakbah, George Town, 10200 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Fisherman's Wharf Food Corner Penang
content: Fisherman's Wharf Food Corner Penang is one of the more contemporary food courts in the city, offering a wide array of cuisines to satisfy any craving. Whether you’re in the mood for Western, Thai, Chinese, Indian, Mexican,
content_more: or Italian dishes, you’ll find it all here. Though prices are slightly higher, the food court provides a comfortable dining experience with a beautiful sea view. It's the perfect spot to enjoy a diverse range of flavors while relaxing by the waterfront.
address: 92A, 1, Lebuh Sungai Pinang, 11600 Jelutong, Pulau Pinang

title: Bee Hwa Cafe
content: Bee Hwa Cafe in Penang is a popular halal Chinese kopitiam, renowned for serving a variety of local Chinese hawker food favorites. The cafe offers a special taste by using only chicken sourced from halal suppliers and fresh se
content_more: afood, making it a must-visit spot for those seeking authentic Chinese flavors in a halal setting. Perfect for tourists and locals alike, Bee Hwa Cafe blends traditional recipes with quality ingredients, ensuring a delightful dining experience.
address: 10, Lebuh Dickens, George Town, 10050 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Ais Tingkap
content: Ais Tingkap is a must-try refreshing drink in Penang. It may look simple, but it’s made through a fun process with shaved ice, sugar syrup, getah anggur, rose essence, basil seeds, Indian herbs, coconut water, and fresh coco
content_more: nut flesh, all topped with more shaved ice. You won’t regret waiting in line for this tasty treat!
address: 2, Lebuh Tamil, George Town, 10100 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: 888 Hokkien Mee (Lebuh Presgrave)
content: 888 Hokkien Mee, located on Lebuh Presgrave, has been a beloved spot for 30 years, known for its Hokkien-style noodles served in a rich prawn soup. The soup's vibrant red color and sweet umami flavor make it a standout. For ad
content_more: ded texture, you can enhance your bowl with options like braised pork ribs or roasted pork, both highly recommended. It's a must-try for anyone looking to experience authentic flavors in Penang!
address: 67-A, Lebuh Presgrave, 10300 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Roti Canai Transfer Road
content: Roti Canai Transfer Road in Penang is a must-visit for delicious, authentic Malaysian breakfast. Enjoy flaky roti canai served with rich, flavorful curries right on the bustling street, offering a unique local experience loved
content_more: by both locals and tourists. Perfect for anyone craving the taste of traditional Penang street food!
address: 114, 110, Jalan Transfer, George Town, 10050 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Moh Teng Pheow Nyonya Koay
content: Moh Teng Pheow Nyonya Koay, located in the heart of Penang, is a must-visit destination for those craving authentic Nyonya cuisine. This charming eatery offers a delightful selection of traditional dishes, expertly crafted usi
content_more: ng time-honored recipes that celebrate the rich heritage of Peranakan culture. With its inviting atmosphere and beautifully presented meals, dining here is not just about great food; it’s a cultural experience. Whether you’re indulging in the aromatic spices of their signature koay or savoring a refreshing dessert, each bite transports you to the vibrant culinary history of Penang. Don’t miss out on this culinary gem during your visit!
address: Moh Teng Pheow Nyonya Koay

title: Ee Beng Vegetarian Food
content: Ee Beng Vegetarian Food offers a fantastic selection of delicious vegetarian dishes at unbelievably affordable prices! This popular eatery in Penang caters to both vegetarians and vegans, featuring a diverse menu that includes
content_more: everything from flavorful curries to hearty stir-fries and mouthwatering rice dishes. The casual and welcoming atmosphere makes it a perfect spot for a quick meal or a relaxed dining experience with friends. Whether you're a lifelong vegetarian or simply looking to enjoy some wholesome, plant-based options, Ee Beng is a culinary treasure that proves healthy eating doesn't have to break the bank!
address: 20, Lebuh Dickens, George Town, 10050 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Vegan Falafel penang
content: Vegan Falafel in Penang is a hidden gem for vegetarians, offering a wide variety of delicious plant-based options. Vegan Falafel in Penang is known for its flavorful Middle Eastern and Western-inspired dishes, especially their
content_more: signature falafel, it's the perfect spot for those craving hearty and healthy meals. Located on a vibrant street, the lively atmosphere is enhanced by the reggae bar next door, which adds to the experience with great music. Whether you're a vegetarian or just a fan of great food, Vegan Falafel is a must-visit destination in Penang!
address: 363, Chulia St, Georgetown, 10200 George Town, Penang

title: Kimberley Street Duck Kway Chap
content: Kimberley Street Duck Kway Chap is a well-loved food stall in Penang that has been serving mouthwatering duck kway chap noodles for over 30 years. This traditional Teochew dish features flat, wide rice noodles in a rich, flavo
content_more: rful meat-based broth and can be paired with duck meat, pork intestine, coagulated blood, hard-boiled egg, preserved vegetables, pork belly, and more. The noodles are homemade using cherished family recipes, giving each bowl a truly authentic taste. If you're exploring Penang's vibrant street food scene, don’t miss the chance to try this must-have local favorite on Kimberley Street!
address: 135, Lebuh Kimberley, George Town, 10100 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Penang State Art Gallery
content: The Penang State Art Gallery is a comprehensive collection devoted to modern and contemporary art. The non-circulating collection documents painting, sculpture, drawings, prints, photography, architecture, design, performance,
content_more:
video, film, and emerging art forms from year 1965 to the present.

The Penang State Art Gallery presents artworks revolving around ideas of identity, urbanization, and globalization. These works raise pertinent issues on urban living in the modern cityscape and prompt us to consider how the artists have translated their visions about these issues into works of art.

Penang State Art Gallery serves as a platform/medium for local and international artists to hold their visual arts exhibitions which is located at Dewan Sri Pinang, Georgetown. As a result of this effort, Penang State Art Gallery has established a joint communication and exchange of ideas between local and international artists.

To enhance and accord prestige of our motherland visual artists, Penang State Art Gallery continues to increase the permanent collections to be equal with other public and private galleries. With this effort, Penang State Art Gallery indirectly gives recognition to the local artists when their artworks serve as a permanent collection and the Penang State Government take pride as the new owner of these permanent collection. Penang State Art Gallery has appreciated the contribution and involvement of every artist in Penang through the retrospective exhibition which is held every year since 2007. Collaboration between the Penang State Museum is not only limited to artists but has also enabled cooperation with higher learning institutions and with local and international art galleries.
address: Jalan Tun Syed Sheh Barakbah, George Town, 10200 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM) Museum And Art Gallery / Muzium & Galeri Tuanku Fauziah USM
content: Muzium & Galeri Tuanku Fauziah (MGTF) USM is amongst the earliest of its kind to be established in a local university. It is the only museum and gallery in this region that combines both the sciences and arts under one roof.
content_more:
Therefore, visiting MGTF promises a holistic and exciting learning and teaching experience. The conceptual premise of the MGTF is the emphasis on the promotion of a balanced symbiosis between heritage, modern and contemporary art, history of science and technology and the challenges of securing a sustainable development for today and the future. MGTF is fast becoming a regionally renowned repository of Malaysia’s artistic, cultural, scientific and technological heritage.  

MGTF USM is also known for its significant collection of modern art in Malaysia. It houses several precious artworks by pioneers of modern art in Malaysia such as Chee Wen Hsi, Chong Siew Peng, Chuah Thean Teng, Ko Ju Ping, Peter Harris, Hossein Enas, Syed Ahmad Jamal, Lee Joo For, Latiff Mohidin, Ibrahim Hussein, Dzulkifli Buyong, Zulkifli Dahlan, Yeoh Jin Leng, Ismail Zain and many more.  Recent works by contemporary Malaysian artists such as Wong Hoy Cheong, Bayu Utomo Radjikin, Ahmad Fuad Osman, Masnoor Ramli, Ahmad Shukri Mohamed, Raja Shahriman, Nur Hanim Khairuddin, Hayati Mokhtar, Sooshie Sulaiman, Nadiah Bamadhaj, Sharon Chin, Vincent Leong and Roopesh Sitharan compliment the works by the pioneers. This collection is also balanced by contemporary art exhibitions from various countries and interactive science and technology exhibitions.  

MGTF USM also features a collection of various cultural artifacts especially those related to the traditional forms of the performing arts such as Mak Yong, Gamelan, Wayang Kulit and Traditional Malay Daggers, other than an extensive collection art and science artefacts from the Islamic world. Chinese calligraphy by Kampo Harada, ethnographic artefacts, traditional tools and equipment of various ethnic groups in Malaysia, gemstone and ancient artefacts further complement the rich repository of artistic, cultural, scientific and technological collections of MGTF USM. These collections are kept alive through various interactive activities in the form of workshops, demonstrations, performances, short courses and lectures.

MGTF USM is a member of International Council of Museums (ICOM), University Museu
address: 808, Jalan Pemimpin, 11800 Gelugor, Pulau Pinang

title: Hin Bus Depot
content: Hin Bus Depot, a former bus terminal transformed into a vibrant cultural center, offers a unique blend of indoor and outdoor art exhibitions, along with a cozy cafe and weekend market. The depot's spacious grounds host multime
content_more: dia exhibition spaces, artistic workshops, cinema screenings, concerts, and pop-up craft markets on Sundays. This contemporary art space showcases progressive artists and artworks within its renovated art-deco buildings. Visitors can also admire murals by renowned artist Ernest Zacharevic that adorn the walls of the depot.
address: 59a, Jalan Timah, George Town, 10030 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Art Bug
content: Art Bug began as a picture framer before becoming an established decor art supplier. They primarily design and create various products from graphical art prints, framed arts, paintings, applied art for architectural and interi
content_more: or decoration items. Art Bug has evolved from the picture framing business into a studio that also designs and creates its own range of products. A group of young artists design the great variety of products at Art Bug. From graphical art prints to paintings, there truly is something for everyone's taste.
address: 10050 Jalan Vermont, 10450 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: The Star Pitt St. (Star Media Group Berhad)
content: This historical three storey building which was built in 1905 was the head office of the Star newspaper from the 1970's to 2002. The Star Pitt Street has been rebranded to celebrate the cultural and diverse heritage of Penang.
content_more:
It now houses the Star's office and a book store on the ground floor, a resource centre and exhibition space on the first floor and The Penang Philharmonic Orchestra on the top floor. The bookstore is worth a visit with a wide range of publications from Areca and some souvenirs on sale.

The Penang based newspaper Star used to be edited and printed in this building, which now has still their advertising office for easy access, the main business is at Bayan Lepas. The space is open to enter and have a brief, but interesting look at the island's colourfull history. Search for the picture of Jimmy Choo, he is a Penangite too. There are books and souvenirs on sale and a free copy of Penang monthly to pick up. It has well written articles about the past glory and modern day life, sponsored by the think tank Penang Institute.
address: 15, Jln Masjid Kapitan Keling, George Town, 10200 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Teochew Puppet & Opera House
content: Situated in an old-style Penang house with its long, narrow architecture and a central atrium, Teochew Puppet and Opera House is a museum of Teochew opera art, the first of its kind in Malaysia. The museum contains exhibits of
content_more: Teochew iron-rod puppets as well as costumes and props from live-size Teochew opera, telling the story of a remarkable family of opera performers over five generations. Visitors may also try on authentic opera costumes and try their hand at manipulating the unique iron-rod puppets. Though it is primarily an exhibition space, the Teochew Puppet & Opera House still occasionally holds opera performances, talks and workshops in the premises after hours.
address: 10200, 122, Lbh Armenian, George Town, 10300 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: The Art Gallery, Penang
content: The Art Gallery, Penang is a place to explore paintings from the past and present. Here, you can discover our current and past exhibitions, makes enquiries, view and perhaps own one of our collection of artworks or purchase ou
content_more:
r art books.

title: Blank Canvas
content:
Blank Canvas is an independent contemporary arts platform which opened in 2022 in George Town, Penang. While modest in space, it is nevertheless ambitious in its twin aspirations.

Taking inspiration from its location within
content_more:
a UNESCO World Heritage site, Blank Canvas seeks to be a bridge between a richly historical city and its broader environs and the international contemporary art world. It aims to promote greater awareness and appreciation in the region of both local and international contemporary art, and also to encourage international contemporary art practitioners to discover and engage with Penang and the region.

More expansively, Blank Canvas also aspires to be a springboard for exploring, and challenging, the twin fundamental notions of what is art and what can be art. In addition to the conventional visual forms of painting and sculpture, Blank Canvas is eager to explore other media such as photography, performance, installation, sound, and even psychology aka mind games, as well as other experiences heretofore unencountered.

To these ends, this eponymous space is a blank slate. It is continually looking for different ways to serve contemporary art and its constituents – the audience and the artists – as an art gallery, an incubator, a residency, a dialogue venue, and more.

On this journey of exploration and evolution, Blank Canvas is guided by the ethos of collaboration. It is humble in acknowledging that it has to engage widely and deeply with the myriad members of the art community to be effective. But it is also confident that it has something to offer to the art community in return.

title: Penang Peranakan Mansion

content_more:

Adopting selected ways of the local Malays and later, the colonial British, the Peranakans had created a unique lifestyle and customs which had not only left behind a rich legacy of antiques but its cultural influences like cuisine and language are still evident in Penang today.

At the Pinang Peranakan Mansion, the typical home of a rich Baba of a century ago is recreated to offer a glimpse of their opulent lifestyle and of their many customs and traditions. With over 1,000 pieces of antiques and collectibles of the era on display, this Baba-Nyonya museum is also housed in one of Penangï¿½s heritage mansion of eclectic design and architecture. Built at the end of the 19th century by one of local historyï¿½s famous personalities, the ï¿½Hai Kee Chanï¿½ or Sea Remembrance Store had once served as the residence and office of Kapitan Cina Chung Keng Kwee. Though not a Baba himself, his Chinese courtyard house was much like a typical large Baba home of eclectic style, incorporating Chinese carved-wood panels and English floor tiles and Scottish ironworks. Having survived the many decades of neglect and decay, the mansion has now been restored to its former glory of a stately home.

content: Bukit Jambul Complex, also known as BJ Kompleks, is a major shopping centre in Bukit Jambul, Bayan Lepas. Located at Jalan Rumbia off Jalan Tun Dr Awang, it has seven storeys of retail space including a basement level. It take
content_more: s about 10 minutes’ drive from the Penang Bridge, Penang 2nd bridge and Penang International Airport. KBJ is proud of the fashion boutiques, mainly catering to the Malay community. These boutiques upholds a commitment for the women looking for classic & timeless cuts and collections that promises style. KBJ is also the one stop mobile phone and IT center where shoppers can come face to face with the latest innovation technologies from the world-renowned brands.

title: Queensbay Mall
content: Queensbay Mall opened for business on 1 December 2006. It is currently the largest, longest and most modern shopping mall in Penang with a gross built up of 2.5 million sq ft and over 1 million sq ft net lettable area. The Mal
content_more: l is located in Bayan Lepas, minutes away from the Penang Bridge, the heart of a prime waterfront development sprawling over a land area of 73 acres. It is the most preferred shopping destination for both the locals and tourists – with 5 levels of retail, Jusco as its anchor tenant with more than 10 junior anchors and 500 retail merchants. Besides a well-planned tenant mix, shoppers can enjoy the “low rise walk-thru” layout which stretches as far as 500 meters with excellent visibility of the shop façade and merchandizing displays. The facility and amenity signages are meticulously planned to enhance the convenience and comfort of the shoppers.The overall interior design and lightings are aimed to create a conducive and safe shopping environment for the whole family. Added to the attractions are the integrated entertainment zone on the third floor that provides a wide range of entertainment and leisure attractions ranging form multiplex to roller skating.Queensbay Mall with its tagline “It’s all happening here!” aptly epitomized the “enriched” lifestyles that Queensbay Mall offers – a place which is vibrant and full of activities, one can shop, play, relax, get together, entertain, be entertained. It is a “family lifestyle mall” of international standard catering to households who are looking for good value for money and the latest in designs and styles. Welcome to Queensbay Mall, it’s all happening here!
address: Queensbay Mall, 100, Persiaran Bayan Indah, 11900 Bayan Lepas, Pulau Pinang

title: Gurney Paragon Mall
content:
Gurney Paragon is a heritage-focused, nine-storey mall along Gurney Drive. It is known for its high
fashion designer brands and carries more than 40 fashion boutiques and 30 restaurants. What makes Gurney Paragon one of a kin
content_more:
d is the fact that the entire 700,000 sq ft complex has been built around St. Joseph’s Novitiate, a chapel dating back to 1925, which has been beautifully restored and incorporated into the mall’s open-plan layout. The mixed development complex comprises the mall,

content_more: shopping mall and a one-stop shopping and entertainment destination catering to both families and tourists arriving in Penang. Gurney Plaza is a nine-storey shopping complex with two levels of basement comprising nine floors of retail space from Basement 1 to the 7th floor and car park spaces at the two basement levels, the 4th to 8th floor and on the rooftop. As Penang’s premier shopping mall, it houses various well-known brands for shopping, dining and entertainment.
address: 170, Persiaran Gurney, Pulau Tikus, 10250 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Gurney Walk

content_more:
pecialty shops and a whole lot of conveniences.

The sea-facing, landscaped alfresco, provide a green space. Think a small green ‘lung’ — a linear park with landscaped features, highlights the alfresco. When inside, creative corners and artistic ambience exudes. Somewhat eclectic, we leave the interior minimalist, to emphasise and showcase our Tenants.

A promenade style layout prevents secondary lanes and blind spots, ensuring a safe and secur

title: 1st Avenue Mall
content:
Set beside Prangin Mall and KOMTAR on Jalan Magazine, the seven-storey 1st Avenue Mall is
one of the flashier additions to Penang’s retail landscape. Its shopping venues are not the only reason to visit; there is also a bow
content_more: ling alley, movie theatre, karaoke lounge, snooker parlour, and internet café. When it comes to food, visitors have a choice of more than 20 restaurants and cafés.

title: KOMTAR Tower
content: Komtar is an icon in Penang, frequently serving as an easily identifiable landmark for travellers exploring Georgetown. Housed under its roof are a collection of atmospheric local boutiques for bargain-hunting fashionistas, as
content_more:
well as lots of electronics stores selling smartphones, computers, tablets. 

The 65-storey tower sits on the junction between Jalan Penang and Jalan Magazine. Komtar is also notable for its viewing deck on the 58th floor, where you can enjoy great views of the island.
address: Lebuh Tek Soon, George Town, 10100 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Gama Supermarket & Departmental Store
content: GAMA is a department store in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. Located at Dato Keramat Road, just opposite Komtar, GAMA was opened in 1967, making it the oldest department store in the State of Penang.In spite of competition fro
content_more: m the nearby shopping malls, the department store still retains its customer base due to its cheaper pricing. The shopping centre contains a total of seven floors, excluding its basement parking lot.
address: Wisma Gama, No.1, Jalan Dato Keramat, 10150 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Prangin Mall
content: Prangin Mall is great for shoppers looking for bargains in Penang, be it fashion or inexpensive electronic goods. The 6-storey retail centre’s anchor tenant is Parkson Grand, plus around 600 brands from all over the world.
address: Prangin Mall, No 33, Jalan Dr Lim Chwee Leong, George Town, 10100 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: 1-Stop Midlands Park Centre
content: Midlands One Stop shopping centre (also called 1-Stop Midlands or Midlands Park) is one of the older malls in Georgetown. It used to be a very popular mall, but when Plaza Gurney was opened to public most went there instead of
content_more: to Midlands. It is located just outside the city centre of Georgetown and about 1 kilometer from Plaza Gurney. The building is clearly recognizable; from almost anywhere in Georgetown you see the two dark red towers of the Georgetown City Hotel that is located within the complex. What strikes is the big slide on the roof; on the upper floor there is a water theme park. There is also a Tune Hotel about 5 minutes from Midlands One Stop; which is a great place to stay for budget travelers.
address: 488, Jalan Burma, 10350 George Town, Pulau Pinang

content_more: freehold land in the Udini neighbourhood along the Tun Dr Lim Chong Eu Expressway, near the Tunku Kudin Interchange. The building has 275,000 sqft of lettable area and 1050 car parking bays.

content_more:
ine Lifestyle Hypermarket for fresh groceries, local and international cooking ingredients, plus Golden Screen Cinemas (GSC) with 11 screens for cinematic enjoyment.

Its other anchor tenants encompass a food court, alfresco dining and cuisine restaurants to cater to a broad range of gastronomic preferences, as well as a fitness centre, karaoke and amusement centre.
address: 105-1, Farlim Square, Jalan Pisang Embun, Kampung Melayu, 11500 Air Itam, Penang

title: Udini Square

content_more: es. The building has three levels of commercial space and a basement parking floor. The ground floor is open for lease as a promotional space. The area is 3,300 sqft. It is connected to Tesco Penang and Vertiq Condominium by link bridges.

Beneath Island Plaza you'll find a large Cold Storage supermarket and at the 4th floor W Cinemax; the first 3D Cineplex in Malaysia. content_more:

Design Village Outlet Mall has 150 stores housing a broad variety of exciting international and local brands, both premium and high street from fashion, beauty, sports, home, restaurants and lifestyle cafes.
address: 733, Jalan Cassia Barat 2, Bandar Cassia, 14110 Simpang Ampat, Pulau Pinang

title: Sunshine Square
content: Sunshine Square is a department store within George Town in the Malaysian state of Penang. Located within the township of Bayan Baru, Sunshine Square was opened in 1993 as the flagship store of the local retail firm, Suiwah Co
content_more:
rporation. The five-storey shopping centre caters to the surrounding community, as well as shoppers from the nearby towns and residential areas such as Bayan Lepas.

The department store off Jalan Mayang Pasir contains a hypermarket, eateries such as McDonald's and Pizza Hut, and function halls for meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions (MICE), as well as a food court.

title: Sunway Carnival Mall

content_more:
ive, residential, industrial and commercial sector of Malaysia’s northern region. The mall is only mere minutes from the crossroads of the North-South and Kulim-Butterworth Highways, and located near the Penang Bridge and Sultan Abdul Halim Ferry Terminal.

The four-storey Sunway Carnival Mall is one of Seberang Perai’s largest malls. The 800,000 sq ft complex houses an extensive variety of retail stores including Parkson Grand and Giant hypermarket; food outlets include fast-food chains such as KFC, Starbucks, Pizza Hut, and Nando’s.

content_more: chor tenant, and there’s also a food court and smaller shop lots that sell everything from electronics to alternative medicine.

title: Pearl City Mall

content_more:
perations, we also provide a variety of services, including credit and loyalty programs, financial services, and online shopping.
