title: Macallum Street Night Market
content: Macallum Street Market invites tourists to experience a vibrant shopping and dining paradise in Penang! Explore an array of affordable T-shirts, watches, decorative items, phone covers, tables, and mats, all at prices lower th
content_more: an other night markets. As you stroll through the lively stalls, enjoy the enticing sounds of sizzling Char Kuey Teow and Apam Balik. Don’t miss out on exotic tropical fruits like mangosteens and durians, along with ready-made delights such as curry puffs, cookies, and hot dishes. Be sure to sample the delicious deep-fried duck meat and succulent chicken roast, making your visit to Macallum Street Market an unforgettable culinary adventure!
address: Lintang Macallum 1, Pengkalan Weld, 10300 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Kimberley Street Food Night Market
content: Kimberly Street Food Night Market is a must-visit for food lovers, situated between Rope Walk and Cintra Street. Known as the “land of four heavenly kings,” this vibrant market features iconic hawker dishes like Duck Porri
content_more: dge & Kway Chap, Kway Chap, Sky Emperor Chicken Feet Koay Teow Soup, and Chicken Meat Koay Teow Soup. Don't miss the Traditional Home of Desserts, where you can indulge in a delightful variety of sweet soup desserts. With its delicious offerings and lively atmosphere, Kimberly Street Food Night Market is the perfect spot to satisfy your culinary cravings!
address: 1, Jalan Sungai Ujong, George Town, 10100 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Batu Ferringhi Night Market
content: Batu Ferringhi Night Market is a lively bazaar of makeshift stalls operated by local traders, stretching for 1 KM and perfect for tourists seeking affordable treasures. Explore a wide range of cheap accessories, including clot
content_more: hes, watches, sling bags, magnets, key chains, colorful jewelry, and even pirated DVDs—ideal for souvenirs to remember your trip to Penang. With Batu Ferringhi Beach just a stone's throw away, you'll also find swimwear and beachwear to suit your seaside adventures. As night falls, the market fills with energy and excitement, so be prepared for a bustling atmosphere. Remember, sellers often quote higher prices, so don’t hesitate to haggle for the best deals!
address: Jalan Pantai Batu, Taman Pantai Batu, 11200 Tanjong Bungah, Pulau Pinang

title: Jelutong Street Market
content: Jelutong Night Market, located on Jalan Van Pragh, is a culinary gem in Penang renowned for its mouthwatering local food. As night falls, the market comes alive, bustling with energy and crowds navigating its narrow lanes. Her
content_more: e, you can find not just delicious snacks like curry fish balls, durians, chocolate cakes, fried dumplings, and assorted dim sum, but also refreshing medicinal drinks like Chinese Herbal Tea for under RM5. Beyond food, the market offers an array of footwear, carpets, and accessories, along with counter-branded clothes at budget-friendly prices. Experience the vibrant atmosphere and indulge in the flavors of Jelutong Night Market!
address: 94, Lrg Batu, Taman Jelutong, 11600 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Farlim Night Market
content: Farlim Night Market, located in Ayer Itam, is truly the food paradise of Penang! This bustling market offers an enticing variety of delicious food alongside a range of items, including clothes, leather handbags, kids’ toys,
content_more: decorative home items, footwear, wooden crafts, dry fruits, and refreshing ice creams. Be sure to try the renowned Frankie Pizza, a favorite among locals, and don't miss the delightful desserts from the Malaysian Mixed Dessert stall, featuring a medley of flavors. For an unforgettable treat, indulge in Tau Fo Fa, a hot and silky smooth bean curd pudding. Farlim Night Market is a must-visit destination for food lovers and shopaholics alike!
address: 27-75, Medan Angsana, Bandar Baru Ayer Itam, 11500 Ayer Itam, Pulau Pinang

title: Uptown Bukit Jambul Night Market
content: Uptown Bukit Jambul Night Market is a vibrant destination for tourists seeking a taste of authentic Malay cuisine and affordable fashion! Explore a delightful array of local dishes that will tantalize your taste buds, while sh
content_more: opping for stylish clothes at great prices. As you wander through the lively stalls, you might even be treated to the sounds of live band performances, creating an unforgettable atmosphere. Whether you’re a food lover or a shopaholic, Uptown Bukit Jambul Night Market promises a fun-filled experience that showcases the best of Penang's culture!
address: Persiaran Bukit Jambul, Kampung Seberang Paya, 11900 Bayan Lepas, Pulau Pinang

title: Sungai Dua Night Market
content: Sungai Dua Night Market is a must-visit destination in Penang, renowned for its delicious array of Malaysian, Chinese, and Indian snacks. As the market comes to life, visitors flock to indulge in mouthwatering treats like Laks
content_more: a, meat skewers, Nasi Lemak, and burgers. Beyond the food, you’ll find Chinese stalls offering shoes, clothes, and accessories, along with fresh items such as sweet corn, pumpkins, cucumbers, sugarcanes, ice golas, readymade sweets, and raw fish. While there's no seating available for dining, the vibrant atmosphere and tantalizing aromas make it the perfect place to grab a quick bite and soak in the local culture!
address: 1, Jalan Sungai Dua, Sungai Dua, 13800 Gelugor, Pulau Pinang

title: Pasar Malam Van Praagh
content: Pasar Malam Van Praagh is one of the largest and must-visit night markets in Penang, offering a fantastic selection of over 100 stalls! Explore a vibrant mix of food trucks, traditional vendors, and accessory stands, making it
content_more: the perfect destination for food lovers and shoppers alike. With such a diverse array of offerings, you’re sure to find delicious local dishes and unique treasures to take home. Don’t miss out on this lively market experience!
address: 52, Jalan Van Praagh, Taman Continental, 11600 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Tanjung Bungah Night Market
content: Tanjung Bungah Night Market may be smaller than other night markets in Penang, but it boasts a delightful variety of items for sale. With several Chinese restaurants, you can indulge in local favorites like Xiao Long Bao—ste
content_more: amed dumplings filled with flavorful soup, served with a blend of soy sauce and fresh ginger. Some stalls even offer seating, allowing you to enjoy a full meal in comfort while soaking up the vibrant atmosphere. It’s a charming spot to explore and savor delicious dishes!
address: Jalan Tanjung Bungah, Taman Tanjung Bunga, 11200 Tanjung Bungah, Penang

title: Paya Terubong Night market
content: Paya Terubong Night Market, located in Ayer Itam, is a vibrant attraction for both tourists and locals alike. Like many night markets in Penang, it offers a diverse range of items, including food, clothes, home gadgets, shoes,
content_more: phone covers, beauty products, and various accessories. Don’t miss the chance to try the Char Koay Teow, known for its unique flavor of fried seafood blended with an array of spices. Other local specialties include spicy rojak, Korean-style fried chicken, and duck pancakes. You can also explore a delightful selection of biscuits, pastries, and cookies displayed in charming tin boxes. Additionally, some stalls offer oils designed to enhance blood circulation, adding to the
address: 1228l, Jln Paya Terubung, Bandar Baru Air Itam, 11500 Ayer Itam, Pulau Pinang

title: Queens Park Night Market
content: Queens Park Night Market is a vibrant destination perfect for families and friends alike! Experience the thrill of go-karting and explore the fun of riding electric bicycles as you stroll through a lively atmosphere filled wit
content_more: h delicious food options. Whether you're looking for a casual evening out or an exciting adventure, this market has something for everyone. Don’t miss the chance to create unforgettable memories with your loved ones at Queens Park Night Market!
address: Dataran Pantai Queensbay, Persiaran Bayan Indah, 11900 Bayan Lepas, Penang

title: Chowrasta Market
content: Chowrasta Market, built in 1890 in the heart of George Town, originally served the South Indian immigrant community. Its name translates to “four cross roads” in Urdu, and today it stands as the largest and greenest market
content_more: in Penang. The market buzzes with locals shopping for fresh produce, affordable household items, and clothing, making it a vibrant spot for people-watching. Visitors can find great local souvenirs, like tau sar piah (bean-paste biscuits) and preserved nutmegs, often at lower prices than in tourist areas. A highlight of the market is the charming second-hand bookshop upstairs, featuring a treasure trove of used books that reach up to the ceiling. Chowrasta Market is a must-visit for anyone wanting to experience the authentic local culture of Penang!
address: Lot 124, Jln Penang, George Town, 10100 George Town, Pulau Pinang

title: Teluk Kumbar Weekly Night Market
content: Teluk Kumbar Weekly Night Market is a delightful destination for food lovers, showcasing a wide variety of Malaysian street foods! Like other night markets, it offers an array of delicious street food, along with dry and wet g
content_more: oods, fresh fruits, and seafood. It’s the perfect spot to immerse yourself in local flavors and experience the vibrant culture of Penang. Whether you’re hunting for tasty snacks or unique ingredients, this market has something for everyone!
address: Bandar Baru Telok Kumbar, 11000 Bayan Lepas, Penang

title: New Lane Street Foodstalls

title: Pinang Peranakan Mansion
content: The Peranakans, also known as the Babas and Nyonyas, was a prominent community of acculturated Chinese unique to this part of the world, especially in the Straits Settlements (Penang, Malacca and Singapore) hence its other nam
content_more:
e, the Straits Chinese. Adopting selected ways of the local Malays and later, the colonial British, the Peranakans had created a unique lifestyle and customs which had not only left behind a rich legacy of antiques but its cultural influences like cuisine and language are still evident in Penang today.

At the Pinang Peranakan Mansion, the typical home of a rich Baba of a century ago is recreated to offer a glimpse of their opulent lifestyle and of their many customs and traditions. With over 1,000 pieces of antiques and collectibles of the era on display, this Baba-Nyonya museum is also housed in one of Penangï¿½s heritage mansion of eclectic design and architecture. Built at the end of the 19th century by one of local historyï¿½s famous personalities, the ï¿½Hai Kee Chanï¿½ or Sea Remembrance Store had once served as the residence and office of Kapitan Cina Chung Keng Kwee. Though not a Baba himself, his Chinese courtyard house was much like a typical large Baba home of eclectic style, incorporating Chinese carved-wood panels and English floor tiles and Scottish ironworks. Having survived the many decades of neglect and decay, the mansion has now been restored to its former glory of a stately home.

content: The Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Centre in Penang is a historical museum and cultural site dedicated to Dr. Sun Yat-Sen, the influential Chinese revolutionary leader and the "Father of Modern China." Located in George Town, Penang, th
content_more:
is center commemorates Sun's time in Penang, where he actively organized and strategized efforts to overthrow the Qing Dynasty, playing a significant role in the Chinese revolutionary movement.

During his stay in Penang in the early 20th century, Dr. Sun Yat-Sen used Penang as a base to raise funds and rally support for the 1911 Xinhai Revolution, which eventually led to the establishment of the Republic of China. The center is housed in a restored heritage building on Armenian Street, reflecting the traditional architectural styles of Penang's historic George Town.

Inside, the Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Centre features exhibits of artifacts, photographs, and documents related to Dr. Sun's revolutionary work, as well as the contributions of the Penang Chinese community. It provides visitors with a window into the early 1900s political climate and a glimpse into the life and legacy of Dr. Sun Yat-Sen in Southeast Asia.

The center also serves as an educational hub, often hosting talks, tours, and exhibitions to preserve and promote awareness of Dr. Sun's impact on the region and his enduring influence on Chinese history.
